ERS is an energy engineering and consulting firm specializing in the assessment and implementation of energy efficiency, renewable energy, and sustainability programs. For over 20 years, ERS has been leading efforts to promote a healthy economy and environment by guiding business, industry, government, and utilities in the efficient use of resources and the advancement of sustainable practices throughout the US.

We are currently seeking Project Engineers for our offices in Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, and New York. Successful candidates will have knowledge of energy systems, energy efficiency, renewable energy, and sustainable practices for commercial and industrial facilities. Experience in efficiency program administration, project management, and measurement and verification of energy-related projects is highly desirable. ERS Project Engineers will be responsible for the following:
	Overseeing the deployment of instrumentation such as power meters and data loggers to measure equipment energy performance
	Performing engineering analyses of efficiency measures
	Preparing comprehensive reports with detailed analytical findings
	Providing technical assistance to facility owners and operators
	Conducting technical review and assessment of energy-related projects
	Conducting customer education and outreach on behalf of our utility clients
	Supporting energy efficiency program efforts including design, development, and delivery services

Candidates must have excellent communication, writing, and computer skills and be able to work closely with customers, vendors, and efficiency program administrators. A bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Energy Engineering, or related field is required; certification as an Engineer-in-Training or CEM, or a master’s/advanced degree, is preferred.

ERS offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience and background, a comprehensive benefits package, and an excellent opportunity for growth. Our company is committed to making a positive contribution to society, and we provide a hardworking yet casual work environment that encourages individual initiative. Learn more about ERS at www.ers-inc.com.

To be considered for the position of Project Engineer, please email your resume to recruiting@ers-inc.com. Include a cover letter explaining your interest in working for ERS in the field of energy engineering. Please include the ERS location(s) you are applying for.

ERS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected class. In addition to federal law requirements, ERS complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. ERS expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on any protected class.

The Head Engineer will be responsible for maintaining the entire building and all its systems in order to ensure the safety of guests, staff members, vendors, patrons and diners. They will be the main point person to provide support for the service and operations teams, enabling them to offer an exceptional experience for all guests and visitors every day.

The ideal candidate for this role is a true problem solver, and enjoys assisting colleagues and helping all departments succeed. This is a leadership position, and candidates must be a passionate contributor to the success of the Hotel on a day to day basis.

The Head Engineer must possess great communication skills and a positive and optimistic approach. They will be able to balance multiple projects and a range of priorities on any given day, and will have a deep foundation of general building systems knowledge and experience.
The Head Engineer is responsible for every aspect of the building infrastructure and the hands on maintenance of all building systems.
They will perform and manage preventative maintenance programs on all equipment and systems within the organization.
They will manage the Engineering team. This includes; scheduling, training, and mentoring to ensure the team is friendly, efficient and committed to the hotel’s success.
They will maintain maintenance inventory and requisition parts and supplies as needed.
They must communicate and prioritize all repairs, maintenance, upgrades, changes, and additions to systems within the building.
They will track and be responsible for deadlines on all projects and report to Ownership and Department Heads.
All projects, maintenance and repairs will be managed in a clean and efficient manner to ensure best results.
They will continuously build relationships with maintenance vendors and equipment and materials suppliers and work with Accounting Department to ensure best pricing for best quality service.
Daily, they will respond and attend to guest and Manager repair requests.
They must maintain compliance with all governing agencies, FDNY, DOH, DOB etc. Manage programs to maintain compliance and stay up to date on all required testing and reporting and training.
They will keep the Hotel in top notch shape; all public spaces and rooms must be clean and well presented at all times. All BOH spaces must be clean and organized at all times.

In addition, this organization is a 24 – 7 – 365 business. The Head Engineer must be available to take emergency calls and be able to respond quickly to assist in resolving issues and supporting staff at any time.
Proven experience successfully managing and leading a team of employees.
Experience and a high level of competence with HVAC, Electrical, Plumbing, Boiler, Cooling Tower, Elevator operations, Sump Pumps and other building related systems.
Experience with and willingness to take a hands-on approach to all these responsibilities.

The Lead Engineer is a vitally important role. They must set up other departments to be successful every day, which requires a commitment to address a multitude of repairs, problems, operational issues, and concerns with a positive approach, flexibility and patience. Balancing the goal of efficiency while working within a 24 -7 operating business presents challenges that can only be overcome with thoughtful plans, which are well prioritized and supported and executed.
Please respond with cover letter and resume.

, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
